title: Simulating first-order phase transition with hierarchical autoregressive networks. (arXiv:2212.04955v2 [cond-mat.stat-mech] UPDATED)
abstract: We apply the Hierarchical Autoregressive Neural (HAN) network sampling algorithm to the two-dimensional $Q$-state Potts model and perform simulations around the phase transition at $Q=12$. We quantify the performance of the approach in the vicinity of the first-order phase transition and compare it with that of the Wolff cluster algorithm. We find a significant improvement as far as the statistical uncertainty is concerned at a similar numerical effort. In order to efficiently train large neural networks we introduce the technique of pre-training. It allows to train some neural networks using smaller system sizes and then employing them as starting configurations for larger system sizes. This is possible due to the recursive construction of our hierarchical approach. Our results serve as a demonstration of the performance of the hierarchical approach for systems exhibiting bimodal distributions. translated_title: 基于分层自回归网络的一级相变模拟
translated_abstract: 我们将分层自回归神经（HAN）网络采样算法应用于二维 $Q$ 状态 Potts 模型，并在 $Q=12$ 时绕过相变进行模拟。我们量化了该方法在一级相变的附近表现，并将其与 Wolff 簇算法进行了比较。我们发现在相似的数值带中，该方法在统计不确定性方面有显着改进。为了有效地训练大型神经网络，我们引入了预训练技术。它使得可以使用较小的系统大小训练某些神经网络，然后将它们用作更大系统大小的起始配置。这是由于我们的分层方法的递归构造而实现的。我们的结果证明了分层方法在具有双峰分布的系统上的性能。此外，我们还提供了在相变附近的自由能和熵的估计。
tldr: 本文通过分层自回归神经网络采样算法成功模拟了二维 $Q$ 状态 Potts 模型中的一级相变，并发现该方法在统计不确定性方面有显着改进。预训练技术可以有效地训练大型神经网络。
en_tdlr: This paper successfully simulates first-order phase transition in the two-dimensional Q-state Potts model using hierarchical autoregressive neural network sampling algorithm, and finds a significant improvement in terms of statistical uncertainty compared to Wolff cluster algorithm. Pre-training technique is introduced to efficiently train large neural networks.
